net.viktorc.detroid.framework.tuning

Class TexelOptimizer

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.viktorc.detroid.util.ASGD<java.lang.String,java.lang.Float>
      • net.viktorc.detroid.framework.tuning.TexelOptimizer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable

    public final class TexelOptimizer
extends ASGD<java.lang.String,java.lang.Float>
implements java.lang.AutoCloseable
    A class for optimizing chess engine evaluation parameters using a stochastic gradient descent algorithm with a possibly parallel cost function. The cost function is that of the Texel Tuning Method which is the average error of the evaluation scores of a set of positions exported from games with known outcomes.
    Author:
    Viktor

    • Constructor Detail

      • TexelOptimizer

        public TexelOptimizer(TunableEngine[] engines,
                      int sampleSize,
                      java.lang.String fenFilePath,
                      java.lang.Double k,
                      java.util.logging.Logger logger)
               throws java.lang.Exception,
                      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Constructs and returns a new instance according to the specified parameters.
        Parameters:
        engines - An array of TunableEngine instances (of which the parameters' gray code string should have the same length). For each non-null element in the array, a new thread will be utilized for the optimization. E.g. if engines is an array of four non-null elements, the fitness function will be distributed and executed parallel on four threads. If the array or its first element are null or the method init hasn't been called on the first element, a NullPointerException is thrown.
        sampleSize - The number of positions to include in one mini-batch. The higher this number is, the slower but more stable the convergence will be.
        fenFilePath - The path to the file containing the FEN list of positions to evaluate. If it doesn't exist an IOException is thrown.
        k - A scaling constant for the sigmoid function used calculate the average error.
        logger - A logger to log the status of the optimization. It cannot be null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If the engines cannot be initialised.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the logger is null, or the sample size is not greater than 0, or the data set is too small.
